intro: Fumaria calcarata var. espathulata, commonly known as the narrow-leafed yellowweed, is a herbaceous plant belonging to the Papaveraceae family. It is characterized by its slender, upright stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces clusters of small, yellowish flowers that bloom in early summer, followed by elongated, slender seed pods. It typically grows in disturbed soils and is found in regions with temperate climates. Due to its delicate structure and ornamental appeal, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
